poem:
**Biochemistry of Blues**

In Edinburgh's grey dawn, Iain dissects despair—  
a petri dish of memory,  
lives lost in chemical swirls,  
where sugars and fats  
map the unseen spiral.  
One million minds, a third lost,  
search for balance  
on the tightrope of silence.  
In the marrow, a whisper:  
the alchemy of hope.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Metabolism and diet are linked to root of bipolar depression, say researchers Iain Campbell, a researcher based at Edinburgh University, has a special perspective on bipolar depression. He lives with the condition and has lost family members who have taken their own lives because of their depression. It remains an intractable, devastating health problem, he says. More than a million people in the UK have bipolar depression, of whom a third are likely to attempt". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
